intro: Salsola cycloptera, commonly known as desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in desert environments. The plant has small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of greenish-yellow flowers. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize disturbed or barren areas. Salsola cycloptera is well adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and low water availability.
